sentences: Johanna Fiedler (September 17, 1945 â€“ May 27, 2011) was an American writer on music and publicist.
Born in Boston, Massachusetts, Fiedler was the daughter of Boston Pops conductor Arthur Fiedler.
In 1994 she published a memoir of her father, Arthur Fiedler: Papa, the Pops and Me.
She was educated at Sarah Lawrence College (graduated 1967).
She then became chief press liaison for the Metropolitan Opera, a position she held from 1975 to 1989.
She later published a book about the Met, Molto Agitato: The Mayhem Behind the Music, in 2001.
She died in Manhattan in 2011 at the age of 65.
